00039 char nToChar(int n, bool upperCase) {
00040     if (n < 10) return char(n+'0');
00041     else if (upperCase) return char((n - 10) + 'A');
00042     else return char((n - 10) + 'a');
00043 }
00044 
00045 } // namespace
00046 
00068 std::string to_string(const integer& n, size_t base, bool uppercase) {
00069     if (n.is_nan()) return detail::nan_text;
00070     if (base<2 || base>36) {
00071         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_base();
00072         else return std::string();
00073     }
00074 
00075     if (n.sign()==0) return "0";
00076 
00077     std::ostringstream out;
00078     if (base==16) {
00079         // Special no-division version, primarily for debugging division
00080         const data_t *ndata=n._get_data();
00081         const digit_t *firstDigit=ndata->digits,
00082             *lastDigit=firstDigit + ndata->mLength - 1;
00083 
00084         const int bitsPerDigit=4;
00085         const digit_t mask=(doubledigit_t(1) << bitsPerDigit)-1;
00086 
00087         // Suppress any leading zeros
00088         const digit_t *d=lastDigit;
00089         int digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bitsPerDigit);
00090         while (digitShift >= 0 && ((*d >> digitShift) & mask) == 0)
00091             digitShift -= bitsPerDigit;
00092 
00093         do {
00094             while (digitShift >= 0) {
00095                 out << nToChar((*d >> digitShift) & mask, uppercase);
00096                 digitShift -= bitsPerDigit;
00097             }
00098 
00099             digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bitsPerDigit);
00100         } while (d-- != firstDigit);
00101 
00102         std::string r(n.sign() < 0 ? std::string("-")+out.str() : out.str());
00103         return r;
00104     } else {
00105         const integer shift=base;
00106         std::pair<integer, integer> a=std::make_pair(n, integer::zero());
00107         a.first._set_negative(false);
00108 
00109         integer r;
00110         while (a.first.sign()!=0) {
00111             a=divide_r(a.first, shift);
00112             out << nToChar(a.second._get_digit(0), uppercase);
00113         }
00114 
00115         if (n.sign() < 0) out << '-';
00116 
00117         std::string rval=out.str();
00118         std::reverse(rval.begin(), rval.end());
00119         return rval;
00120     }
00121 }

00149 integer from_string(const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00150     if (str==detail::nan_text) return integer(not_a_number());
00151 
00152     bool negate=false;
00153     const char *c=str.c_str();
00154     if (*c=='+') ++c;
00155     else if (*c=='-') { negate=true; ++c; }
00156 
00157     if (base==autobase) {
00158         if (*c=='0') {
00159             ++c;
00160             if (*c=='x' || *c=='X') {
00161                 ++c;
00162                 base=16;
00163             } else base=8;
00164         } else base=10;
00165     }
00166 
00167     if (base<2 || base>36) {
00168         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_base();
00169         else return integer(not_a_number());
00170     }
00171 
00172     if (*c==0) {
00173         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_digit("No valid digits");
00174         else return integer(not_a_number());
00175     }
00176 
00177     const integer shift(base);
00178 
00179     integer r;
00180     while (*c) {
00181         unsigned int digit;
00182         if (*c>='0' && *c<='9') digit=*c-'0';
00183         else if (*c>='A' && *c<='Z') digit=*c-'A'+10;
00184         else if (*c>='a' && *c<='z') digit=*c-'a'+10;
00185         else {
00186             if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_digit("encountered non-alphanumeric character in string");
00187             else return integer(not_a_number());
00188         }
00189 
00190         if (digit >= base) {
00191             if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_digit("encountered digit greater than base allows");
00192             else return integer(not_a_number());
00193         }
00194 
00195         r = (r * shift) + digit;
00196         ++c;
00197     }
00198     r._set_negative(negate);
00199     return r;
00200 }

00211 integer from_binary(const std::string& str) {
00212     const size_t bytesPerDigit=sizeof(digit_t);
00213     const size_t bitsPerByte=std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00214 
00215     integer r;
00216     detail::data_t *rdata=r._get_data();
00217     rdata->alloc((str.length() + bytesPerDigit - 1)/bytesPerDigit);
00218     digit_t *p=rdata->digits;
00219 
00220     unsigned char *s=(unsigned char *)str.data(), *se=s+str.length();
00221     while (s<se) {
00222         digit_t d=0;
00223         for (size_t i=0; i<bytesPerDigit && s<se; ++i)
00224             d |= (digit_t(*s++) << (i * bitsPerByte));
00225         *p++=d;
00226     }
00227     rdata->skipLeadingZeros();
00228     return r;
00229 }
00230 
00247 std::string to_binary(const integer& n) {
00248     n._throw_if_nan();
00249 
00250     const size_t bytesPerDigit=sizeof(digit_t);
00251     const size_t bitsPerByte=std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00252     std::vector<unsigned char> temp;
00253     temp.reserve(n._get_length() * bytesPerDigit);
00254 
00255     const detail::data_t *ndata=n._get_data();
00256     const digit_t *p=ndata->digits, *pe=p+n._get_length();
00257     while (p != pe) {
00258         digit_t d(*p++);
00259         for (size_t i=0; i<bytesPerDigit; ++i) {
00260             temp.push_back((unsigned char)(d));
00261             d >>= bitsPerByte;
00262         }
00263     }
00264     while (!temp.empty() && temp.back()==0) temp.pop_back();
00265     char *c=(char*)&temp[0];
00266     return std::string(c, c+temp.size());
00267 }
